text: Oskar Fischer (14 July 1929 - 26 April 2003) was an Austrian football player. He played as defender for FK Austria Wien. He also played one match for the Austrian national football team ==Career == Fischer started playing football in the youth department of FK Austria Wien. In 1948 he was called up to the first team squad. In total, he played 482 times for the Violets (including friendly games). By the end of his career in 1962, he and his team won five championship titles and three cup victories. ==International == On September 30, 1956, he played his only international match for Austria against the Luxembourg selection as part of the qualification for the 1958 World Cup Player profile ÖFB ==Honours == *5 x Austrian championː 1948/49, 1949/50, 1952/53, 1960/61, 1961/62 *3x Austrian Cupː 1948/49, 1959/60 , 1961/62 ==References == Category:1929 births Category:Austrian footballers Category:Players of the Austrian national football team Category:Austrian football defenders Category:Association football defenders Category:2003 deaths Category:Austrian football champions
title: Oskar Fischer (footballer)
